go2svg.py - plot results of a GO analysis¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This script creates a colourful plot in svg format from the results of a GO analysis.

Usage¶

Example:

python go2svg.py --help

Type:

python go2svg.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: go2svg.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  -e, --headers         first row is a header [ignored].
  -t TITLE, --title=TITLE
                        page title.
  -f FOOTER, --footer=FOOTER
                        page footer.
  --maxP=MAX_PVALUE     maximum P-value displayed [default=none].
  --maxQ=MAX_QVALUE     maximum Q-value for controlling for FDR
                        [default=none].
  -c COL_NAMES, --column-titles=COL_NAMES
                        comma separated list of column titles [default: use
                        filenames].
  -p PATTERN_FILENAME, --pattern-filename=PATTERN_FILENAME
                        pattern to map columns to filename.
  -A, --Annotator       use Annotator-style input files.
  --annotator-fdr       use fdr computed from annotator [default=False].
  -T THRESHOLDS, --thresholds=THRESHOLDS
                        7 comma-separated fold-change threshold values
  -P PVALUES, --pvalues=PVALUES
                        6 comma-separated p value threshold values
  -C, --altcolours      Use alternative colour palette
  -X DELIMS, --delimiters=DELIMS
                        Delimiter characters for annotation label
  -Z IGNORE, --ignore=IGNORE
                        Ignored characters in annotation label
  --fdr=FDR             filter output by FDR (requires annotator output).
                        [default=none]
  -a TEMPLATE, --template=TEMPLATE
                        layout template to choose - affects colours.
  --sort-columns=SORT_COLUMNS
                        sort columns. The default, unsorted, list columns in
                        the order that they are supplied on the command line
                        [default=unsorted]
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
